p:
To evaluate the protective activity of rE-induced antibodies, heat-inactivated immune sera were passively transferred to ZIKV susceptible A129 mice. Serum samples (days 70 through 112) of mice immunized with rE M + alum and rE D + alum (days 70–112) were pooled and 500 µl of immune sera (per mouse, n = 5), or vehicle control serum ( n = 3) was injected into A129 mice, via intraperitoneal route 1 day prior to ZIKV challenge. The ZIKV-neutralizing mAb G9E
23 was used as a positive control (200 µg/mouse, n = 3). Mice were challenged with 1000 FFU of ZIKV (H/PF/2013) by subcutaneous footpad inoculation. Mice were weighed daily for 14 days and monitored for clinical disease signs. Mice losing 30% of their starting weight were humanely euthanized.
